title: Mobile Language Learning Assessment and Design: Core Strategies for Pre-Service Teachers (Grammar·Vocabulary·Text Interaction-Centric Approaches)

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic pedagogy and language education theories (communicative language teaching, content-based instruction, text-based learning theories)
context.additional_context: Enhancing K-12 language education design capabilities by applying mobile learning theories and assessment frameworks in smartphone-centric constrained technology environments. Special emphasis is placed on improving reading comprehension and expressive skills, with the goal of cultivating comprehensive language proficiency through grammar/vocabulary/text analysis.

learning_goals: Explain three elements to consider in mobile language learning design based on the FRAME model and TDT theory: context-based grammar integration, situation-specific vocabulary enhancement, and multimodal text interaction
Develop three or more language learning assessment tools applicable in smartphone environments (writing analysis apps, pronunciation evaluation AI tools, real-time grammar checkers)

Within one week, learners will propose two or more methods to apply personalized feedback systems (e.g., ChatGPT-based real-time expression feedback) and gamification (e.g., point/badge systems) to digital portfolios or language exchange platforms in mobile language learning design, and achieve 'excellent' ratings in at least two of three peer evaluation rubric criteria (creativity, feasibility, effectiveness)

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
